Introduction
Jeffrey H. Skevington currently works at the Ottawa Research and Development Centre, Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada. Jeff does research in Entomology, Evolutionary Biology and Systematics (Taxonomy). His current projects revolve mostly around taxonomy and phylogenetics of Syrphidae and Pipunculidae (Diptera).

Systematics and Biogeography of world Stylogaster Macquart (Diptera: Conopidae)
Archived project
Understand the phylogenetic relationships of Stylogaster species and their historical patterns of distribution, using Hennig's "holomorphology" concept to gather as many data as possible.
View
Taxonomy of the Conopidae (Diptera) of the Nearctic Region
Project
This project aims to revise all conopid genera (Dalmannia, Myopa, Physocephala, Physoconops, Robertsonomyia, Stylogaster, Thecophora and Zodion) of the Nearctic region mainly north of Mexico. Particular focus is given to refining species’ concepts using genitalia, exterior morphology, and COI molecular data.
